details.purpose: To predict the occurrence of cardiovascular disease (CVD) events using hypnopompic heart rate variability (HRV) metrics and machine learning models.
details.methodology: Machine learning models, particularly using the XGBoost algorithm, were constructed using HRV metrics and other typical CVD risk factors for both long-term and short-term prediction of CVD outcomes.

important_features: Complexity Metrics of HRV like MSE1, MSE2, MPE

details.contribution: HRV metrics, especially entropy-based indices, demonstrated significant importance in predicting CVD outcomes within two years.
details.data_source: Sleep Heart Health Study (SHHS), an open access database.
